sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SPREMBERG, a small town of Prussia, in the province of Brandenburg, is situated about 75 miles to the southeast of Berlin, partly on an island in the river Spree and partly on the west bank. It carries on considerable manufactures of woollen cloth, and has greatly advanced in importance and population since the beginning of the 19th century. In 1885 its population numbered 11,011. The only building of note is the ch√¢teau, built by a son of Elector John George about the end of the 16th century.
